    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AnsiColor
    The AnsiColor enum represents ANSI color codes for foreground and background text styling.
    Client
    Client class that initializes the connection to the server and starts the user interface.
    Client2
     
    ClientTMP
     
    Color
     
    Direction
     
    GUI
    The GUI class represents the graphical user interface for the Galaxy Trucker game.
    HelloApplication
     
    HelloController
     
    IllegalGUIEventException
    The IllegalGUIEventException class represents a custom runtime exception that is thrown when an illegal or invalid event occurs in the GUI.
    JsonCardParsing
    JsonCardParsing is class,that actually converts Json Strings (using Json) into actual Card Class
    JsonParsing
    JsonParsing is used to build different Tiles from Json(JsonCards)
    Observer
    Observer interface for the Galaxy Trucker game.
    RemoteObserver
    RemoteObserver class implements the Observer interface and is used to observe changes in the Game state.
    RMIClient
    RMIClient is the client-side implementation of the VirtualClient interface.
    RMIServer
    RMIServer is the server-side implementation of the VirtualServer interface.
    SceneManager
     
    Server
    Server class that initializes both RMI and Socket servers.
    ServerController
    ServerController is responsible for managing the game state and communicating with clients.
    SocketClient
    SocketClient is the client-side implementation that connects to the server using sockets.
    SocketClient2
     
    SocketClientHandler
    This class handles the communication between the server and a client.
    SocketServer
    The SocketServer class listens for incoming client connections on a specified port.
    TUI
    The TUI class represents the Textual User Interface for the Galaxy Trucker game.
    UI
    The UI interface defines the contract for user interfaces in the Galaxy Trucker game.
    VirtualClient
     
    VirtualServer
    Interface for the VirtualServer, which extends Remote to allow RMI communication.
    VirtualServerSocket
    Implementation of the VirtualServer interface that uses an ObjectOutputStream to send messages to the server.
    VirtualServerSocketInterface
    Interface for the VirtualServerSocket, which defines methods for sending messages to the server.
